blog.name: alle23212
blog.title: Alle.
blog.description:
librisognierealta.it è il mio blog.
Ho sempre sentito il bisogno di averne uno, ma non avevo mai trovato un argomento che mi spingesse a continuare a scrivere, finché non ho abbracciato la mia natura ossessia-compulsiva e assolutamente pignola! Da questo è nato il mio blog di recensioni e scleri di vario genere: Libri, Sogni e Realtà.

summary: Dal libro alla serie: Game of Thrones - Terza stagione (parte 1/3)
title: Dal libro alla serie: Game of Thrones - Terza stagione (parte 1/3)
body:
Dal libro alla serie: Game of Thrones – Terza stagione (parte 1/3)

Dal libro alla serie: Game of Thrones – Terza stagione
(Parte 1/3)

Siamo già alla terza stagione di Game of Thrones e al terzo libro de Le cronache del ghiaccio e del fuoco.

Andiamo con ordine e introduciamo per bene l’argomento: abbiamo già iniziato a vedere i primi capitoli del terzo libro parlando delle Differenze sulla seconda stagione.

Il volume tre è stato pubblicato nell’ottobre del 2000…

View On WordPress

summary: For The Throne Promo - Quick Take 2  This is a quick clip of the three remaining contenders for the Iron Throne in Season 8. It...
caption:
For The Throne Promo - Quick Take 2

This is a quick clip of the three remaining contenders for the Iron Throne in Season 8. It shows them at a time when they were most vulnerable.

It is notable that Jon and Cersei have had numerous highs and lows. But Daenerys has never been more powerless than she was in the first episode of Season 1. She has just got more and more powerful and untouchable since then.

It is almost as if they are trying to distract us from the fact she is no longer that ethereal ingénue, but a power hungry, cruel, and merciless conqueror.

summary: Bittersweet
title: Bittersweet
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Bae2Jn

by emmaliza

Margaery is forced to work in her grandmother’s cafe, and acquires a customer who hates coffee, but doesn’t want to let on to her boyfriend.

She gets in over her head.

summary: Sam: She sounds like quite woman Aemon: and she is alone under siege. No family to guide or protect her the last relation...
caption:
Sam: She sounds like quite woman

Aemon: and she is alone under siege. No family to guide or protect her the last relation thousands of miles away useless dying  

Sam: Don’t say that Maester Aemon 

Aemon: Targaryen alone in the world is the most terrible thing

And immediately Jon entered the room

 

Targaryen will never be alone again.Dany and Aegon Targaryens

summary: ΕΠΙΤΕΛΟΥΣ ΔΙΑΟΛΕ! Ανακοίνωσαν την πρεμιέρα της τελευταίας σεζόν του Game of Thrones!
title: ΕΠΙΤΕΛΟΥΣ ΔΙΑΟΛΕ! Ανακοίνωσαν την πρεμιέρα της τελευταίας σεζόν του Game of Thrones!
body:
ΕΠΙΤΕΛΟΥΣ ΔΙΑΟΛΕ! Ανακοίνωσαν την πρεμιέρα της τελευταίας σεζόν του Game of Thrones!

138 και σήμερα λέμεεε! Δείτε το teaser trailer.

Λογικά, δεν θα είστε εδώ για να διαβάσετε και τις λοιπές λεπτομέρειες, αφού, από τον τίτλο και μόνο μάλλον θα ανεβήκατε σε ταράτσες, κεραίες, στύλους, κάστρα και με καπνογόνα στο χέρι βγήκατε να πανηγυρίσετε για την είδηση της ημέρας, του μήνα, του έτους ολόκληρου. Άλλωστε, δεν περιμέναμε και λίγο μέχρι τη στιγμή που το HBO θα ανακοινώσει την…

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: Why I'm No Longer Waiting for The Winds of Winter
body:
Why I’m No Longer Waiting for The Winds of Winter

Because it’s not coming? Duh.

Just kidding.

I’m one of those fans who discovered this great story through the show, not the books.

Having seen what the show had aired so far and dying to know what’s next, I bought the books to satisfy that craving… and also to vaccinate myself against spoilers.

Knowing things such as Robb’s and Joffrey’s murders before the show revealed them was simply amazing. I truly was, for a while, omniscient. And I enjoyed the fact that I knew more than what the show was telling. (Books are inherently more comprehensive than their TV/movie adaptations because the platform allows the writer to keep creating without having to worry about production constraints such as budget and duration.)

Throughout the years, I realized I like the show much more than the books. The way it simplifies the story and makes it more coherent with less unnecessary detours was very appealing to me.

Some of the changes the show made to the books that I really enjoyed are 1) replacing Roose Bolton with Tywin Lannister in Harrenhal (The dynamic between him and Arya Stark was just more poignant that way.); 2) shortening Jaqen H'ghar’s murder spree (The show hid how much effort it actually took Jaqen to execute Arya’s escape, making it look as if he didn’t even break a sweat and thus portraying him as an even bigger badass.); and 3) scrapping Lady Stoneheart. (Not only did I hate that boring storyline, the show including it would have made Jon Snow’s resurrection far less impactful and surprising because it wouldn’t have been as “impossible”.)

It was when the show was about to keep up with the books that I really started to hope for The Winds of Winter’s release. I was panicking! My omniscience was about to run out — a superpower I’d been used to having over the past few years.

But then my worst fear happened… The show did overtake the books. And honestly? It wasn’t a tragedy.

Now that the show is ahead of the books in telling the story means to me that Game of Thrones is now the canon. A Song of Ice and Fire has been dethroned. The show is now the original, the source, the one that matters.

As many fans know, so that the production of the show doesn’t halt because there are no more books to adapt, GRRM revealed the story’s ending to the show’s producers. The skeleton was there — and it came from GRRM himself. The show’s writers just needed to embellish it.

Unless The Winds of Winter (and A Dream of Spring) come out before the show’s finale airs next year, it will be Game of Thrones that will reveal this epic story’s ending to us, not A Song of Ice and Fire. The show’s ending will be the first telling and therefore the official. Whatever the last two books say after that will be nothing more than just “GRRM’s version” instead of “the Gospel truth” as the first five books were.

And actually, even if by some miracle both books do come out before the show concludes… Game of Thrones has already revealed things that The Winds of Winter will only begin to tackle. So even then, Game of Thrones’ take would be the default.

I fell in love with the show at first sight. And thanks to the books, I learned many of what’s next before the show aired them. The books gave me omniscience once. But now that the show has overtaken the books, omniscience is not something the books can ever give me again. (Only leaks can give me that now. LOL) And so when they come out (if that happens before I or GRRM die), I will have no use for them anymore. I started this journey with the show. And through GRRM’s lack of diligence, I will end this journey with the show.

I’ll still grab a copy, of course. Just because the complete series will look good on my bookshelf. I can’t promise I’ll actually read them. After all, I’m not really into fan fiction, which is kind of what they’ll be to me by then.

reblog.comment:
Why I’m No Longer Waiting for The Winds of Winter

Because it’s not coming? Duh.

Just kidding.

I’m one of those fans who discovered this great story through the show, not the books.

Having seen what the show had aired so far and dying to know what’s next, I bought the books to satisfy that craving… and also to vaccinate myself against spoilers.

Knowing things such as Robb’s and Joffrey’s murders before the show revealed them was simply amazing. I truly was, for a while, omniscient. And I enjoyed the fact that I knew more than what the show was telling. (Books are inherently more comprehensive than their TV/movie adaptations because the platform allows the writer to keep creating without having to worry about production constraints such as budget and duration.)

Throughout the years, I realized I like the show much more than the books. The way it simplifies the story and makes it more coherent with less unnecessary detours was very appealing to me.

Some of the changes the show made to the books that I really enjoyed are 1) replacing Roose Bolton with Tywin Lannister in Harrenhal (The dynamic between him and Arya Stark was just more poignant that way.); 2) shortening Jaqen H'ghar’s murder spree (The show hid how much effort it actually took Jaqen to execute Arya’s escape, making it look as if he didn’t even break a sweat and thus portraying him as an even bigger badass.); and 3) scrapping Lady Stoneheart. (Not only did I hate that boring storyline, the show including it would have made Jon Snow’s resurrection far less impactful and surprising because it wouldn’t have been as “impossible”.)

It was when the show was about to keep up with the books that I really started to hope for The Winds of Winter’s release. I was panicking! My omniscience was about to run out — a superpower I’d been used to having over the past few years.

But then my worst fear happened… The show did overtake the books. And honestly? It wasn’t a tragedy.

Now that the show is ahead of the books in telling the story means to me that Game of Thrones is now the canon. A Song of Ice and Fire has been dethroned. The show is now the original, the source, the one that matters.

As many fans know, so that the production of the show doesn’t halt because there are no more books to adapt, GRRM revealed the story’s ending to the show’s producers. The skeleton was there — and it came from GRRM himself. The show’s writers just needed to embellish it.

Unless The Winds of Winter (and A Dream of Spring) come out before the show’s finale airs next year, it will be Game of Thrones that will reveal this epic story’s ending to us, not A Song of Ice and Fire. The show’s ending will be the first telling and therefore the official. Whatever the last two books say after that will be nothing more than just “GRRM’s version” instead of “the Gospel truth” as the first five books were.

And actually, even if by some miracle both books do come out before the show concludes… Game of Thrones has already revealed things that The Winds of Winter will only begin to tackle. So even then, Game of Thrones’ take would be the default.

I fell in love with the show at first sight. And thanks to the books, I learned many of what’s next before the show aired them. The books gave me omniscience once. But now that the show has overtaken the books, omniscience is not something the books can ever give me again. (Only leaks can give me that now. LOL) And so when they come out (if that happens before I or GRRM die), I will have no use for them anymore. I started this journey with the show. And through GRRM’s lack of diligence, I will end this journey with the show.

I’ll still grab a copy, of course. Just because the complete series will look good on my bookshelf. I can’t promise I’ll actually read them. After all, I’m not really into fan fiction, which is kind of what they’ll be to me by then.

summary: Sat-nav firms warned ‘beware Dark Hedges’
title: Sat-nav firms warned ‘beware Dark Hedges’
body:
Satellite navigation companies are to be contacted by police about dangerous junctions near the Dark Hedges made famous by TV drama Game of Thrones.

Concerns were raised after an American tourist was killed in a crash in September at a crossing on the Gracehill Road in County Antrim.

It has been suggested information shown on in-car systems could be misleading.

Michael Munro, 31, was on honeymoon when his car was involved in a collision with another vehicle.

The cause of the Connecticut man’s death is still under investigation.

There have been at least three other collisions, at the two main junctions near the road made famous by the HBO series since August.

  • Traffic ban on Dark Hedges road begins
  • Dark Hedges suffer Easter crowds and cars
  • Game of Thrones road closure proposed

At a meeting with police and the Roads Service, DUP MLA Mervyn Storey asked how the road network could be made safer for an increasing number of tourists.

“There has been some work that has been carried out. We have now got most of the new Give Way signs up, with the yellow backing,” Mr Storey said.

“We are still waiting on the enhancement of the road alignment, in terms of the markings on the road.

“But we have an ongoing discussion still as regard to issues such as sat-nav directional information to this area.

“If you use any or most of the systems you will see that there is a constant blue line which goes through the Gracehill Road (from the Bregagh Road), that could give you the impression that the road continues and that it is not a junction,” he added.

Rosie Leech, PSNI head of road policing, confirmed officers would be making contact with sat-nav companies through an online tool which allows the public to rectify incorrect or out-of-date mapping information.

“While sat-nav is increasingly popular as a means of selecting a route, we always advise road users to be aware of their surroundings, plan their journeys, look out for road warning or information signs and always follow official diversion routes,” she warned.

The North Antrim MLA said he had a “difference of opinion” with the PSNI and Roads Service over whether a Stop sign should be placed at the dangerous junctions instead of a Give Way sign.

“Visitors to this area, do they understand what a Give Way sign is about? Do they understand the difference in the signs if they come into Dublin and they make their way north into Northern Ireland?” he added.

Bill Kennedy, a business owner in the nearby village of Armoy, said safety on the Gracehill Road had been an ongoing problem.

“Anything that improves road safety is more than welcome from my point of view,” he said.

“We are not talking rocket science or millions of pounds to put up additional signs to help people travel to their destination, to keep them on the right road, to keep them safe.”

The Dark Hedges became a huge draw for tourists and TV fans after they appeared, albeit very briefly, in the closing scene of one episode of Game of Thrones.

Related Topics

  • Game of Thrones
  • Armoy
  • Police Service of Northern Ireland

Read more: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-northern-ireland-46174251

The post Sat-nav firms warned ‘beware Dark Hedges’ appeared first on Viral TV News.



from WordPress http://www.viraltvnews.com/game_of_thrones/sat-nav-firms-warned-beware-dark-hedges/

summary: Két új sorozat is jön George R. R. Martintól
title: Két új sorozat is jön George R. R. Martintól
body:
Két új sorozat is jön George R. R. Martintól

A Trónok harca alapjául szolgáló könyvsorozat szerzője, George R. R. Martin másik híres ciklusa, a Wild Cards adaptációs jogait ugyan már 2016-ban eladta a Universal Cable Productionsnek, amiből  most készül két sorozat is  a Hulu stream csatornára.

A könyvsorozatból 1986 óta 27 kötet jelent meg, a története egy földönkívüli vírussal indul, ami 1946-ban kiszabadult New Yorkban, és azokat, akiket…

View On WordPress

A könyvsorozatból 1986 óta 27 kötet jelent meg, a története egy földönkívüli vírussal indul, ami 1946-ban kiszabadult New Yorkban, és azokat, akiket…
